title: Reproductive toxicity of emerging plasticizers, flame retardants, and bisphenols, using culture of the rat fetal testis
reasoning: The abstract compares the toxicity of DEHP and its replacements, specifically 2,2,4-trimethyl-1,3-pentanediol diisobutyrate, diisononyl-phthalate, and diisodecyl adipate. It states that only BPA and MEHP (a metabolite of DEHP) significantly decrease testosterone secretion, while some replacements show little toxicity in the fetal rat testis model. This indicates that these replacements are less toxic and thus safer alternatives to DEHP.

target_chemical_harm.rationale: The reasoning text explicitly states that bis(2-ethylhexyl)phthalate (DEHP) has endocrine disrupting activities. It also mentions that MEHP, a metabolite of DEHP, significantly decreases testosterone secretions, reduces luteinizing hormone-stimulated testosterone, decreases germ cell density, and decreases Sertoli cell proliferation in fetal rat testis organ culture.

CHEMICAL HARM: endocrine disrupting activities, decrease testosterone secretions, reduced luteinizing hormone-stimulated testosterone, decrease in germ cell density, decreased Sertoli cell proliferation
